1.text: Words of a Gatherer, son of an obedient one, the declaration, an affirmation of the man:—I have wearied myself for God, I have wearied myself for God, and am consumed.

2.text: For I am more brutish than any one, And have not the understanding of a man.

3.text: Nor have I learned wisdom, Yet the knowledge of Holy Ones I know.

4.text: Who went up to heaven, and cometh down? Who hath gathered the wind in his fists? Who hath bound waters in a garment? Who established all ends of the earth? What is His name? and what His son’s name? Surely thou knowest!

5.text: Every saying of God is tried, A shield He is to those trusting in Him.

6.text: Add not to His words, lest He reason with thee, And thou hast been found false.

7.text: Two things I have asked from Thee, Withhold not from me before I die.

8.text: Vanity and a lying word put far from me, Poverty or wealth give not to me, Cause me to eat the bread of my portion,

9.text: Lest I become satiated, and have denied, And have said, ‘Who is Jehovah?’ And lest I be poor, and have stolen, And have laid hold of the name of my God.

10.text: Accuse not a servant unto his lord, Lest he disesteem thee, and thou be found guilty.

11.text: A generation is, that lightly esteemeth their father, And their mother doth not bless.

12.text: A generation—pure in their own eyes, But from their own filth not washed.

13.text: A generation—how high are their eyes, Yea, their eyelids are lifted up.

14.text: A generation—swords are their teeth, And knives—their jaw-teeth, To consume the poor from earth, And the needy from among men.

15.text: To the leech are two daughters, ‘Give, give, Lo, three things are not satisfied, Four have not said ‘Sufficiency;’

16.text: Sheol, and a restrained womb, Earth—it is not satisfied with water, And fire—it hath not said, ‘Sufficiency,’

17.text: An eye that mocketh at a father, And despiseth to obey a mother, Dig it out do ravens of the valley, And eat it do young eagles.

18.text: Three things have been too wonderful for me, Yea, four that I have not known:

19.text: The way of the eagle in the heavens, The way of a serpent on a rock, The way of a ship in the heart of the sea, And the way of a man in youth.

20.text: So—the way of an adulterous woman, She hath eaten and hath wiped her mouth, And hath said, ‘I have not done iniquity.’

21.text: For three things hath earth been troubled, And for four—it is not able to bear:

22.text: For a servant when he reigneth, And a fool when he is satisfied with bread,

23.text: For a hated one when she ruleth, And a maid-servant when she succeedeth her mistress.

24.text: Four are little ones of earth, And they are made wiser than the wise:

25.text: The ants are a people not strong, And they prepare in summer their food,

26.text: Conies are a people not strong, And they place in a rock their house,

27.text: A king there is not to the locust, And it goeth out—each one shouting,

28.text: A spider with two hands taketh hold, And is in the palaces of a king.

29.text: Three there are going well, Yea, four are good in going:

30.text: An old lion—mighty among beasts, That turneth not back from the face of any,

31.text: A girt one of the loins, or a he-goat, And a king—no rising up with him.

32.text: If thou hast been foolish in lifting up thyself, And if thou hast devised evil—hand to mouth!

33.text: For the churning of milk bringeth out butter, And the wringing of the nose bringeth out blood, And the forcing of anger bringeth out strife!
